stimulusHtml: Which of the following graphs could depict this situation, where volume, in cubic centimeters, is the independent variable and radius, in centimeters, is the dependent variable?

features.html: The figure shows a sphere that can expand. As it expands, the volume inside the sphere and the radius of the sphere both increase. In particular, the radius increases at a decreasing rate with respect to the volume.

choicesHtml:
• Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale.
  • The x axis is labeled Volume, in cubic centimeters.
  • The y axis is labeled Radius, in centimeters.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins on the positive y axis.
    • The curve decreases, sharply at first and then at a lesser and lesser rate.
    • The curve ends just above the positive x axis.

• Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale.
  • The x axis is labeled Volume, in cubic centimeters.
  • The y axis is labeled Radius, in centimeters.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the origin.
    • The curve increases, sharply at first and then at a lesser and lesser rate.
    • The curve ends at the top right of the window in the first quadrant.

• Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale.
  • The x axis is labeled Volume, in cubic centimeters.
  • The y axis is labeled Radius, in centimeters.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins on the positive y axis just above the origin.
    • The curve increases, nearly horizontal at first and then at a greater and greater rate.
    • The curve ends at the top right of the window in the first quadrant.

• Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale.
  • The x axis is labeled Volume, in cubic centimeters.
  • The y axis is labeled Radius, in centimeters.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins on the positive y axis.
    • The curve decreases, gradually at first and then at a greater and greater rate.
    • The curve ends at a point just above the positive x axis.
